distributional 0.5.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.07610163 10.09754897
variance(dist)
#> [1] 0.8382545 0.7813312
skewness(dist)
#> [1]  0.1748488 -0.1825208
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  0.91698203 -0.75096428 -0.54159436 -0.32806467 -1.15018052  1.58301322
#>  [7]  0.81959245  1.91569077 -0.01695794 -0.16481239
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  9.393425  9.595117 11.647313  9.105871 10.316726 10.548811  9.925953
#>  [8]  9.393425  9.004760  9.925953
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.292615 0.000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))
dimnames(dist) <- c("x", "y")

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#>                x        y
#> [1,] 0.008746344 9.904445
variance(dist)
#>               x          y
#> [1,] 0.98890882 0.00694827
#> [2,] 0.00694827 0.70828068
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>                 x         y
#>  [1,]  0.22991078 10.296057
#>  [2,]  0.52385676  9.506505
#>  [3,] -0.13567761 10.794906
#>  [4,] -1.35048647 10.334429
#>  [5,]  0.05987437  9.186671
#>  [6,] -1.35048647 10.334429
#>  [7,]  2.48363892  8.657501
#>  [8,]  0.53150247 10.531504
#>  [9,] -1.18328773  8.062686
#> [10,] -0.01490665  8.114936
#> 
quantile(dist, 0.4) # Returns the marginal quantiles
#>               x        y
#> [1,] -0.2208052 9.738666
cdf(dist, matrix(c(0.3,9), nrow = 1))
#> [1] 0.38
